acorn_grove_0.introduce: You wake up in an acorn grove, seemingly smaller than usual.

intro_squirrel.name: Eckard
intro_squirrel.attack: You try to throw a punch, but you realize you're a squirrel
intro_squirrel.interact: "Hello fellow squirrel ... Wait! You're not supposed to be a squirrel! You need to get to the demetamorphinator! I think Gottfried knows where it is. Ask him!"
intro_squirrel.inspect: Eckard's large bushy tail sways in the ever so acorn grove wind, catching colorless squirrel weather intuitions.

portal_squirrel.name: Gottfried
portal_squirrel.attack: You try to throw a punch, but you realize you're a squirrel.
portal_squirrel.interact: "Curious Curious Curious ... You're looking for the 'demetamorphinator?' Just follow me!" You follow Gottfried into the hollow of a tree, but just as you cross the threshold, you stumble over your squirrel claws and fall into a gaping chasm ...
portal_squirrel.inspect: Gottfried's matted and unruly fur is knotted in ways that would puzzle the most dedicated of knot theorists.

storey_i_0.name: Lobby
storey_i_0.introduce: *Crash!* You land on a sofa in the University of South Carolina M Bert Storey Research and Innovation Center Lobby! The lights have not yet begun to quit their work, but it still seems like there's something you're failing to acknowledge about this room.

storey_i_1.name: Janitor's Dusty Old Closet
storey_i_1.introduce:
You enter a dusty old closet that vaguely smells of the American Nuclear Society's 2002 article on the scientific contributions of Enrico Fermi.
There isn't much sun in here.

storey_i_2.name: Hallway
storey_i_2.introduce: You enter a narrow and unremarkable hallway. Nothing interesting could possibly happen here.

intro_joe.name: THE Joe Hardy
intro_joe.introduce: You see the comparatively enormous stature of Joe Hardy leaning against a wall.
intro_joe.attack: You try to scratch Joe, but he kicks you back.
intro_joe.interact: "Oh shoot, you can talk? Anyway, I'm assuming you want to get through that door. The first thing you'll need is a sunflower seed butter and hummus sandwich."
intro_joe.inspect: Joe's hair contains hints of green so slight they might be mere references to the past.

sans_sandwich_joe.name: STILL Joe Hardy
sans_sandwich_joe.introduce: You see Joe staring at you: "Nice to see you again but where's the sandwich?"
sans_sandwich_joe.attack: You try to kick Joe, but he dodges and says, "Hey! I thought we were friends."
sans_sandwich_joe.interact: Joe appears angry: "How dare you come back without the sandwich?". Then he adds, "That's okay, but what else do you have in your inventory?"
sans_sandwich_joe.interact_sandwich: You hand over the sunflower seed butter and hummus sandwich to Joe. He says: "(munches) Thanks for the sandwich, but if you look closely (munches again), the door was open all along."
sans_sandwich_joe.inspect: Joe thinks aggressively about a sandwich ... and inklings.

sandwich_joe.name: Joe Hardy, plus a sandwich
sandwich_joe.introduce: You see Joe eating a sandwich.
sandwich_joe.attack: Joe doesn't care anymore, as long as he has his sandwich.
sandwich_joe.inspect: On a table next to joe you see a no longer sealed food safe jar of hummus and a no longer sealed food safe jar of sunflower seed butter.

elephant_in_the_room.name: The elephant in the room
elephant_in_the_room.interact: You address the elephant in the room. "Wow, I feel recognized! I no longer need this sealed, food-safe jar of comforting sunflower seed butter!"
elephant_in_the_room.attack: "Ouch! but at least someone is acknowledging me."
elephant_in_the_room.inspect: Everyone in the room is avoiding looking at the elephant.

security.name: Security Bread
security.introduce: You bump into a security guard roaming around the floor.
security.attack: You try to punch the security, but he manhandles you to the ground and handcuffs you. **He had the right bread but you choose violence instead.**
security.interact:
"You want the right right bread, right? Right. Answer my riddle right and you'll be left left with the right right bread:
Left Left-Right, son of Right Right and Left Left, brother of Right Left-Right, writes right, drives right. Left Left LEFT Left Left-Right with Right Right and Right Left-Right, which isn't right. Who is left?"
security.right_answer: Right, "Right"! Right, You'll now be left left with the right right bread.
security.non_right_answer: Sorry, but that answer just isn't 'right'!
security.inspect: The security guard seems partially (mentally) composed of left and right hands. Where one would expect a set of shoes, he instead has wisdom.

almanac.name: Friendly Sunflower and Dusty Old Almanac
almanac.introduce: You find a personable sunflower and an extremely rusty, beat-up almanac laying in the janitor's closet.
almanac.attack: You tear up the pages, leaving pieces scattered around. The pieces suddenly reform and reveal the book to be %d pages away from losing it.
almanac.interact: "Hello, squirrel. I've been searching through this book all day, but every time I get five pages in, it closes on me."
almanac.inspect:
The sunflower has all the aspects characteristic of such a creature:
A bright ring of ray florets, smaller, dimmer, inner florets, and a rough stalk.
You wonder how it remains bright in as dull a location as a janitor's closet.
The almanac has 32 pages, which may somehow be connected to the number 5...
almanac.too_high: The book rustles in a way so as to indicate that a better page might precede the current.
almanac.too_low: The book rustles in a way so as to indicate that a better page might succeed the current.
almanac.correct_page:
"Wow, you found the right page! ... Wow, this is brilliant!
It says here that for the next year, the sun will move from east to west! I'm saved! I don't need this spatially conditionally usable slice of bread anymore!"
almanac.break:
"If I knew you were just going to fail, I wouldn't have let you touch the book in the first place! How am I ever going to find the sun?!"
The almanac slams shut and bursts into flames.
A new dusty old almanac is born from the ashes.

found_almanac.name: Friendly Sunflower and Distinct Lack of Almanac
found_almanac.introduce: You find a personable sunflower and a spot where an almanac used to be...
found_almanac.attack: You slash your squirrel claws at the lack of an almanac and create a lack of action.
found_almanac.interact: "Hello, squirrel. Thanks for helping me solve the puzzle. I can finally be sure of the sun's location from within this dim closet!"
found_almanac.inspect:
The sunflower has all the aspects characteristic of such a creature:
A bright ring of ray florets, smaller, dimmer, inner florets, and a rough stalk.
You wonder how it remains bright in as dull a location as a janitor's closet.
The almanac has 32 pages, which may somehow be connected to the number 5...

trash_can.name: Trash Can
trash_can.introduce: You see the only available trash can on the 1st floor.
trash_can.attack: You knock over the trash can, revealing a sealed, clean, food-safe hummus.
trash_can.inspect: Flies circulate around the trash bin.

first_door.name: Mysterious Door
first_door.introduce: This door is probably, most definitely locked.
first_door.interact: The door wasn't locked! You travel up the stairs to the next floor.
first_door.inspect: The glowing door has a surprise behind it.

storey_ii_0.name: Plant Office
storey_ii_0.introduce: You enter an academic office with a standard desk, chair, and a bookshelf.

storey_ii_1.name: Blue Room
storey_ii_1.introduce: You enter a room with three identical doors.

pitcher_plant.name: Pitcher Plant
pitcher_plant.introduce: You see a professional baseball pitcher sitting behind the desk.
pitcher_plant.interact:
"Hi, squirrel! What a wonderful day to play baseball!
If you go into the next room, you must pass through three correct doors. Passing through an incorrect door will land you in the same place.
Just remember, go through the door that rings with the most life!
pitcher_plant.attack: You jump at the pitcher, but she hits you out of the air with a baseball bat. You fly into the wall at 98 miles per hour.
pitcher_plant.inspect: Pitcher Plant is wearing a pinstriped baseball uniform with patches of dirt on it.

door1_0.name: nondescript door
door1_0.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

door1_1.name: nondescript door
door1_1.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

door1_2.name: nondescript door
door1_2.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

door1_3.name: nondescript door
door1_3.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

door1.name: nondescript door
door1.interact: You move through the door and enter a new room.
door1.attack: You throw yourself against the door, and it shakes like the smell of a blooming citrus tree.
door1.inspect: You see absolutely nothing remarkable about this door.
door1.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.
door1.final_door: You move through the door and find a very long flight of stairs. You slowly proceed up them...

door2.name: nondescript door
door2.interact: You move through the door and see the door you just walked through shut in front of you. You're in the same room you started in.
door2.attack: You throw yourself against the door, and it shakes like a hot, dry, dust-laden wind.
door2.inspect: You see absolutely nothing remarkable about this door.
door2.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

door3.name: nondescript door
door3.interact: You move through the door and see the door you just walked through shut in front of you. You're in the same room you started in.
door3.attack: You throw yourself against the door, and it shakes like melting prevernal snow...
door3.inspect: You see absolutely nothing remarkable about this door.
door3.introduce: You see a door so closed that Rome must be at peace.

storey_iii_0.name: Fin Foyer
storey_iii_0.introduce: You enter a culminating room, filled with urgency and a feeling that you might be nearing the end of your adventure...

man.name: man
man.attack: Man doesn't respond to your attempts to attack.
man.introduce:
What manual page do you want?
For example, try 'man man'.
man.interact: There's nothing to interact with, only a mere wish to know more...
man.inspect: You don't see anything, but you feel millimeters away from endless knowledge.

computty_blocked.attack: You scratch at the glass, but you realize that keratin has a Mohs hardness of 2.5 and glass has a Mohs hardness of 5.5.

microwave_blocked.name: Demetamorphinator
microwave_blocked.introduce: You behold the Demetamorphinator, the machine the Squirrels wish to destroy.
microwave_blocked.attack: You try to attack the Demetamorphinator open, but you damage a claw.
microwave_blocked.inspect: The Demetamorhphinator has a popcorn button, a pizza button, and an option to reheat frozen meat.
microwave_blocked.interact: The Demetamorphinator is locked. Despite all your wishing, it won't open.

microwave_unblocked.name: Demetamorphinator
microwave_unblocked.introduce:
As you step towards the demetamorphinator, you feel your claws begin to tremble as a stampede of squirrels rushes towards you, screaming like a horde of demons.
You jump farther and just barely reach it, suddenly  realizing that if you use the Demetamorphinator, you won't have time to destroy it after and the squirrel hegemony will reign.
You can: 
Attack and destroy it now, and remain a squirrel.
Interact with it, and ignore the well-being of countless squirrels.
microwave_unblocked.inspect: In your minute moment of thought, you examine the Demetamorphinator and reflect on your past decisions: Intro to Kantian Ethics in sophomore year; Every squirrel you've ever seen with a family, a life; The Russell House 70th anniversary (with squirrels). Is it worth sacrificing the well-being of millions of squirrels for your own selfish humanity?
microwave_unblocked.attack: You grab a fork off the ground and throw it into the microwave, slam it shut, and press the 30 seconds button, just as you're hit by a wall of squirrel mass. As the Demetamorphinator melts, you sink into simultaneous sorrow and satisfaction: You've saved your own humanity by sacrificing it for the lives of millions of squirrels. As your squirrel body is ripped to shreds by the now further enraged mass of oppressive squirrels, you stare off into the setting sun and think "Was I ever human, until now?"
microwave_unblocked.interact:
You grab a fork off the ground and throw at a calculated angle into the air as you leap across the floor into the Demetamorphinator, slamming the door shut behind yourself. The carefully calculated fork hits the 30 seconds button and you begin to increase in size, just as the mass of angry squirrels pounds against the glass. Your arms grow longer, your spine shrinks in proportion, and your legs stretch out...

You wake up in the beaver field with a roaring headache. Everything is bright, but you begin to make out a group of people standing over you. "Are you alright, son? That beaver hit you pretty hard." one of them says. "Yeah, I'm fine," you say, curious at the sound of your own voice.
You walk towards your car beaverless and sit down to drive, but accidentally sit on something. As you reach down to check your back pocket, you find a metal fork with hummus residue.

sock_squirrel.name: Angry squirrel with one sock
sock_squirrel.attack: You throw a punch at the angry squirrel, which then becomes placated and unlocks CompuTTY
sock_squirrel.inspect: You see a squirrel as angry as an aggressively unwatered plant.
sock_squirrel.interact: You try to negotiate peacefully with the squirrel, but it just snarls and screams.
sock_squirrel.introduce: You see a squirrel with one squirrel-sized sock on. You think it might know something, but it just keeps snarling and screaming.

Thanks for playing Escape: A Storey!
Special thanks to Joe Hardy for permission for his appearance and for his excellence in teaching assistance.
